intro: Forsteronia pycnothyrsus, commonly known as the dense-thorned forsteria, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Forsteronia pycnothyrsus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
